intro: Hancea penangensis, commonly known as Penang hancea, is a flowering plant native to the Malaysian state of Penang. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide range of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
